field_set.name: Basic Info
field_set.description: What kind of entity is it? Where does it live and on what does it survive? What "style" or "brand" identifies it, how might it be classified? Is this project unlike any other or one of a clearly defined species?

select.name: UNIX + Internet
select.description: Projects that directly interacts with or depends on the ecology of low-level UNIX-based tools and Internet-based services such as UNIX operating systems, C compilers, source code management systems (SCM), POSIX standard components, internet protocols and services.

select.name: AppStore
select.description: Any of various platforms that provide "apps" which are tied (tethered) to specific devices, specific software development platforms and/or sold through specific outlets (like the Apple App Store).

select.name: API/Application Specific
select.description: Any of various projects that depend on an Application Programming Interface (open or not) to allow for the existence of the service (e.g. Google Maps, Facebook's Graph API).

select.name: Gaming Environments/Platforms
select.description: Games or persistent worlds that rely on specific software or hardware environments (which may in turn rely on other components and services) and cannot be accessed without that software/hardware.

select.name: HTML, HTTP, and Associated Services
select.description: Primarily web-based.  Uses assorted tools and technologies that are primarily accessible through ports like http, https, etc.

select.name: Television and Internet Video
select.description: Any of various projects those primary ecology is moving visual media.

select.name: Wiki
select.description: Wiki-powered website for community organizing, documentation and related projects

select.name: Darknet
select.description: Private, anonymous internetworked machines that are not accessible via Internet without certain applications (Tor, GNUnet,  VPN clients, P2P clients). Examples include but are not limited to: Freenet, GNUnet, Inivisible Internet Project, Onionland.

select.name: Mobile
select.description: Operates primarily as a stand-alone application on a suitable mobile device (phone, tablet. May be downloaded via an app store.

value_options.name: Social Networking
value_options.description: Internet-based projects and companies specialized in social networking

value_options.name: Education
value_options.description: Educational platforms and projects based on the Internet

value_options.name: Science and/or Engineering
value_options.description: Projects that allow participation in science or engineering, such as citizen science, and including medical research

value_options.name: Games/Persistent Worlds
value_options.description: online games, role-playing games, persistent virtual worlds etc.

value_options.name: Craft, DIY, Consumer goods
value_options.description: Projects that enable participation in making, remaking or learning how to make things, often for sale.

value_options.name: Activist
value_options.description: groups organized for social or political change; independent media organizations; hacktivists; advocates and other coalitions.

value_options.name: Internet Forum / Mailing List
value_options.description: Discussion Forums, Image Boards, Mailing Lists, Underground communities etc.

value_options.name: Culture Industry
value_options.description: Media making from mainstream to remix to participatory/fan culture.

value_options.name: Social Entrepreneurialism
value_options.description: Focused on volunteerism, fundraising, or cause-related participation

field_definitions_attributes.name: Brand
field_definitions_attributes.description: Describe how the brand / logo / visual identity is positioned.
